title: first letter missing from every command in initialization
body:
#### Code Sample

```stata
set obs 10000
  generate u1 = runiform()

```
#### Problem description

I'm using the setup with Atom and Hydrogen, so I hope this is the correct place to report this issue. Apologies if not.

So I created a very simple test.do file with just the above code to see how everything works. The first time i press CTRL+Enter some kind of initialization happens and some commands get executed in stata (`cd ".do File Directory"`; `set more on`; etc.). However, from every command (except the first one) the first letter is missing (`et more on`; `et pagesize 100`; etc).

#### Expected Output
No errors.

#### Debugging log

<!--
If you're using `console` mode, there should be a file named
~/.stata_kernel_cache/console_debug.log. This is helpful to see for debugging
information. Note that this has all the commands and output up to where the
program crashed.
 -->

I didn't find this.

#### Package Version

<!-- You can find the package version with `pip show stata_kernel` -->

1.4.1

Windows 10

Stata 13.0, MP-64

(I had to install the package by manually setting the `stata_path` in` install.py`. Don't know if this causes the problem. Seems unlikely.)

#### Received Output
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17196288/45001653-3e1d5180-afcf-11e8-85d3-0f6bbdc85720.png)
